subTitle: Ask us anything about our Kung Fu school and training programs, and get accurate and detailed responses.

faqs.question: What styles of martial arts do you teach at One Heart School?
faqs.answer: At One Heart School, we teach traditional Chinese martial arts with a focus on the Lam Family Hung Gar Kung Fu style. This system emphasizes strong stances, powerful strikes, and effective self-defense techniques.

faqs.question: How often should my child attend Kung Fu classes?
faqs.answer: We recommend that your child attends Kung Fu classes at least two times a week to ensure consistent progress and skill development.

faqs.question: When are Kung Fu classes for kids scheduled?
faqs.answer: We offer kids' Kung Fu classes six days a week, with sessions available on weekday afternoons and Saturday mornings to accommodate various schedules.

faqs.question: Is Kung Fu safe for my child?
faqs.answer: At One Heart School, we prioritize safety in all our training sessions. Our curriculum is designed to be as safe as possible while still providing effective martial arts instruction. Kung Fu training is generally safer than many other sports and physical activities.

faqs.question: How do I enroll my child into One Heart School of Kung Fu?
faqs.answer: To enroll your child, contact us to schedule a visit to our school. You can meet our instructor team, tour our facilities, and learn more about our programs. We are conveniently located for easy access.

faqs.question: What benefits can my child gain from practicing Kung Fu at One Heart School?
faqs.answer: Practicing Kung Fu at One Heart School can help your child develop physical fitness, discipline, self-confidence, and respect. Our training also emphasizes the cultural and historical aspects of Kung Fu, enriching their overall learning experience.
